thread.title: Alleged DUI driver in Bakersfield Christmas Parade crash faces more charges, arrested - Bakersfield Now
thread.title_full: Alleged DUI driver in Bakersfield Christmas Parade crash faces more charges, arrested - Bakersfield Now

author: BakersfieldNow Staff
title: Alleged DUI driver in Bakersfield Christmas Parade crash faces more charges, arrested - Bakersfield Now
text:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. (KBAK/KBFX) â€” Bakersfield police announced the alleged DUI driver accused of hitting three people at the
[Bakersfield Christmas Parade](bakersfield christmas parade) was arrested and is facing additional charges.
The Bakersfield Police Department said officers have continued the investigation into the crash which happened on December 7th.
RELATED:
Family of parade crash victim to pursue legal action against alleged DUI driver, mayor's message to family
BPD said as a result of the investigation, it was determined charges associated with assault with a deadly weapon and resisting arrest were applicable in addition to the charges of driving under the influence.
RELATED:
"I don't think we made an insensitive decision truthfully": Parade organizers share why they continued with the show following a crash
Police said on Dec. 28, 2023, Alan Booth was released from medical care and was booked into the Kern County Jail for assault with a deadly weapon, driving under the influence, and resisting arrest.
The crash left three men injured, ages 21, 42, and 77.
Two of the victims were identified as
 Rocky and Dominic, a father and son.
The third victim was identified as
Arnold Rios.
